questions.question_text: Which two of the following will be used for ingress traffic on the Edge node supporting a Single Tier topology? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Inter-Tier interface on the Tier-0 gateway
choices.D: Downlink Interface for the Tier-1 DR
choices.C: Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct.

Selected Answer: BC
The two interfaces that will be used for ingress traffic on the Edge node supporting a Single Tier topology are:
B) Tier-0 Uplink interface
C) Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR

questions.question_text: Which TraceFlow traffic type should an NSX administrator use for validating connectivity between App and DB virtual machines that reside on different segments?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
As in the official 4.1 vmware guide.

questions.question_text: Which two tools are used for centralized logging in VMware NSX? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Correct as in the official vmware guide.

Selected Answer: AB
the correct answer is AB

Selected Answer: AB
Correct, as in the official guide

Selected Answer: AB
Saw in the ICM 4.0 p.595.

The following L2 VPN clients are recommended:
1. NSX Managed NSX Edge in a separate NSX Managed environment.
• Overlay and VLAN segments can be extended.
2. Autonomous Edge:
• Enables L2 VPN access from a non-a NSX environment to NSX environments.
• Deployed by using an OVF file on a host that is not managed by NSX.
• Only VLAN segments can be extended.

questions.question_text: Which two are supported by L2 VPN clients? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A. Edge Node:

 Network Introspection is typically configured on Edge Nodes in NSX, where network traffic can be inspected for security and other purposes.
 The Edge Node plays a crucial role in service insertion, where additional services (such as firewalls, IDS/IPS, or other security tools) are inserted into the traffic flow.

E. Partner SVM (Service Virtual Machine):

 A Partner SVM is a virtual machine provided by a third-party partner (such as a security appliance) that is integrated with NSX for service insertion.
 Service insertion allows the integration of third-party appliances into the network traffic flow for inspection or other purposes, and this is done using Partner SVMs.

Selected Answer: AE
Tier-1 gateway: Tier-1 gateways are used for east-west traffic, but introspection is not configured at the gateway level directly.
